column3: Sept 21 General Motors Co on Wednesday affirmed its forecast for 2016 profit of up to $6.00 per share and said it expected to exceed its cost-savings target of $5.5 billion by 2018 as the automaker unveiled a new effort to convince investors of its value.

UPDATE 4-Senate Republicans seek probe of Mylan EpiPen oversightMedicare EpiPen spending outpaces prescription growth: Kaiser reportMylan shares languish at low valuation as EpiPen hearing nearsSenate Republicans seek probe of Mylan EpiPen oversightU.S. lawmakers grill Mylan CEO over EpiPen steep price increasesUPDATE 2-U.S. lawmakers blast Mylan CEO over 'sickening' EpiPen price hikesU.S. lawmakers blast Mylan CEO over 'sickening' EpiPen price hikes WASHINGTON U.S. lawmakers on Wednesday blasted Mylan NV Chief Executive Heather Bresch for sharply increasing prices for the EpiPen emergency allergy treatment at a congressional hearing in which Republicans and Democrats questioned the reasons behind rising U.S. drug costs.  U.S. lawmakers blast Mylan CEO over 'sickening' EpiPen price hikes WASHINGTON U.S. lawmakers on Wednesday blasted Mylan NV Chief Executive Heather Bresch for sharply increasing prices for the EpiPen emergency allergy treatment at a congressional hearing in which Republicans and Democrats questioned the reasons behind rising U.S. drug costs. WASHINGTON

U.S. lawmakers blast Mylan CEO over 'sickening' EpiPen price hikes WASHINGTON U.S. lawmakers on Wednesday blasted Mylan NV Chief Executive Heather Bresch for sharply increasing prices for the EpiPen emergency allergy treatment at a congressional hearing in which Republicans and Democrats questioned the reasons behind rising U.S. drug costs. UPDATE 3-U.S. SEC charges fund manager Cooperman with insider trading NEW YORK
column3: Sept 21 The top U.S. securities regulator on Wednesday charged billionaire investor Leon Cooperman with insider trading
column4: making him the highest-profile target in years in Washington's ongoing crackdown on illegal trading at hedge funds.
